RootTable.Filter: SELECT o.ea_guid AS CLASSGUID, o.object_type AS CLASSTYPE, o.name FROM t_object o WHERE o.package_id IN (#Branch#) AND object_type = 'Class' AND NOT EXISTS (select * from t_diagramobjects do inner join t_diagram d on do.diagram_id = d.diagram_id where d.name = #Concat '<Search Term> ', o.name#); #DB=COMMENT# Find the classes that don't have a context diagram. A context diagram must be a class diagram and it must have a name consisting of (1) the term specified as search term (e.g. "Context diagram" or "Kontekstdiagram") (2) a space and (3) the name of the class. This query is intended to be used in a model view, where the search term is fixed and valid only in a given language. #DB=COMMENT#
